metadata.Description: Electrolysis is a chemical process that uses an electric current to drive a non-spontaneous chemical reaction, such as the splitting of water into hydrogen and oxygen.

electrolysis.Description: Electrolysis employs renewable energy sources such as solar and wind to produce hydrogen through the electrolysis process.
Electrolysis collaborates with fuel cell technology to utilize the produced hydrogen as a clean and efficient energy source.
Electrolysis supports decarbonization efforts by providing a carbon-free method of producing hydrogen for various applications.
Electrolysis administers hydrogen production facilities where the electrolysis process takes place to produce hydrogen gas.
Electrolysis measures the purity of the produced hydrogen to ensure its quality and suitability for various applications.
Electrolysis aligns with the transition to renewable energy sources by utilizing renewable electricity for the electrolysis process.
Electrolysis is an instance of an electrochemical process where an electric current is used to drive a non-spontaneous chemical reaction.
